alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Broome and northeastern Susquehanna Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kirkwood, or 9 miles southeast of Binghamton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Susquehanna, Susquehanna Depot, Hallstead, Great Bend, Lanesboro and Hickory Grove. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 80 and 81. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 near 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York...and northeastern Pennsylvania.
